channel.title: Changing where the wilderness is. [help]
channel.description:
Ok. I'm using a PimpScape Source, and it's all based on PKing. I want to change were the wilderness is. Any tips on changing that?
-thanks-

item.title: Changing where the wilderness is. [help]
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Lol yeah.

Or you could do it all backwards.

I would do it backwards, but if your experienced enough.

Packet 73 handles attacking in wilderness.

Instead of where it says:

if(!nonWild() && w.e here

if(insideWildy && w.e else is there
IsAttacking = true;
inCombat();
//etc
} else {
player is in safezone.

So in the method:

insideWildy() which you will make, just put the X and Y Coords of the area you want to make pking. and thats all. But if i’m correct theres other shit in client.java that checks pking so you have to make the neccesary changes.

Oh and also please tell me your not planning for the wildy in your server to be like in runescape, like out there in that forest area? Because if you are there is a much easier way to do this…

Read full topic

item.title: Changing where the wilderness is. [help]
item.dc:creator: @Unholy_Devil Unholy Devil
item.description:
@Unholy_Devil wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Bitch, post:7, topic:165805”]Um wait lemme find notes real quick…here!

(absX >= SW && absX <= NE && absY >= SW && absY <=NE )

Search the method:

nonWild()

It’s a boolean, that returns true or false.

At the end where it says like:

absY <=1234 ) ||

After that " || ":

Put the:

absX >= SW && absX <= NE && absY >= SW && absY <=NE )

You have to fill in The SW’s And NE’s.

First go to the SouthWest Corner and get the X and Y’s.

Where it says:

absX >=

Put the X Coordinate of the SouthWest Corner.

Where it says:

absY >=

Put the Y Coordinate of The SouthWest Corner.

Now for NorthEast do the same.[/quote]

mmk. So like i need to log on and go all the way to the corner of the map?

Read full topic

item.title: Changing where the wilderness is. [help]
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Um wait lemme find notes real quick…here!

(absX >= SW && absX <= NE && absY >= SW && absY <=NE )

Search the method:

nonWild()

It’s a boolean, that returns true or false.

At the end where it says like:

absY <=1234 ) ||

After that " || ":

Put the:

absX >= SW && absX <= NE && absY >= SW && absY <=NE )

You have to fill in The SW’s And NE’s.

First go to the SouthWest Corner and get the X and Y’s.

Where it says:

absX >=

Put the X Coordinate of the SouthWest Corner.

Where it says:

absY >=

Put the Y Coordinate of The SouthWest Corner.

Now for NorthEast do the same.
